variance_contributors.root_cause: Multiple major component failures (gearbox, generator, blade) led to significantly higher unscheduled repair costs. Implementing more robust predictive maintenance could help prevent such failures.
Increased reliance on external expertise for complex repairs and maintenance tasks. Developing in-house capabilities and negotiating better subcontractor rates could reduce this variance.
Underestimation of spare parts needs, particularly for major components. Improving inventory management and forecasting can help optimize spare parts stock levels.

key_budget_priorities: Enhance in-house technical capabilities through staff training
cost_saving_measures: Negotiate better rates with subcontractors for specialized services
Standardize maintenance procedures to improve efficiency
